subject: Mathematics
subs: read, write, and identify the place and value of each digit in a three-digit numeral, with and without models;
identify the number that is 10 more, 10 less, 100 more, and 100 less than a given number up to 999;
compare and order whole numbers between 0 and 999; and
round two-digit numbers to the nearest ten.

subject: Mathematics
subs: count forward by twos, fives, and tens to 120, starting at various multiples of 2, 5, or 10;
count backward by tens from 120; and
use objects to determine whether a number is even or odd.

subject: Mathematics
subs: count and identify the ordinal positions first through twentieth, using an ordered set of objects; and
write the ordinal numbers 1st through 20th.

subject: Mathematics
subs: name and write fractions represented by a set, region, or length model for halves, fourths, eighths, thirds, and sixths;
represent fractional parts with models and with symbols; and
compare the unit fractions for halves, fourths, eighths, thirds, and sixths, with models

subject: Mathematics
subs: recognize and use the relationships between addition and subtraction to solve singlestep practical problems, with whole numbers to 20; and
demonstrate fluency with addition and subtraction within 20

subject: Mathematics
subs: estimate sums and differences;
determine sums and differences, using various methods; and
create and solve single-step and two-step practical problems involving addition and subtraction.

subject: Mathematics
subs: count and compare a collection of pennies, nickels, dimes, and quarters whose total value is $2.00 or less; and
use the cent symbol, dollar symbol, and decimal point to write a value of money.

text: The student will estimate and measure
subject: Mathematics
subs: length to the nearest inch; and
weight to the nearest pound.

text: The student will tell time and write time to the nearest five minutes, using analog and digital clocks.
subject: Mathematics
Mathematics
subs: draw a line of symmetry in a figure; and
identify and create figures with at least one line of symmetry

text: The student will identify, describe, compare, and contrast plane and solid figures (circles/spheres, squares/cubes, and rectangles/rectangular prisms).
subject: Mathematics

text: The student will use data from probability experiments to predict outcomes when the experiment is repeated.
subject: Mathematics
Mathematics
subs: collect, organize, and represent data in pictographs and bar graphs; and
read and interpret data represented in pictographs and bar graphs.

text: The student will identify, describe, create, extend, and transfer patterns found in objects, pictures, and numbers.
subject: Mathematics

text: The student will demonstrate an understanding of equality through the use of the equal symbol and the use of the not equal symbol.
subject: Mathematics
